intro: Ranunculus atrovirens, commonly known as the black-leaf buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Asia and Europe. It features striking, bright yellow flowers with five petals and a distinctive, hairy, dark green foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
